DYeQ_TT5xDrIwqXJTUs-8g.text: Great environment and location is right across the street from Talking Stick Arena which is why we chose this place.  Food was delicious, especially the filet mignon. Fish n Chips were awesome.  The pretzel appetizer bites were delicious with the cheese sauce.

c7h01R9_CwTxsND82Vc3zA.text: Not amazing. Just "fine" Focused on high volume sacrificing quality.  Prime Rib was underseasoned.

4Ww3QqpOocsutSAxh_ql9Q.text: This is such a fun place. Food is excellent and the bar is big and nice to sit at. The restaurant is steaming with all sorts of people that are fun to watch. I really like the food as well as the atomosphere

Dn0kGegoZ_em5AbqVB499w.text: We came here during Comicon to grab some drinks and food. The service was amazing. Our waiter was incredibly helpful and sweet. I ordered the turkey pastrami sandwich on a pretzel bun. My husband ordered the fish tacos and said they were great. Everyone else in our group really enjoyed their food as well.  I can't wait to come back the next time we're downtown.

MZPrPRlLItkuy5vEtO9RUw.text: I work in a top 3 restaurant in LA and The Arrogant Butcher is anything but. The fish and chips were juicy, flaky, and flavorful. Devin, my server, was genuine, knowledgeable, and friendly. Management dropped off food with a smile. Only thing is, the Tuscany coffee felt more like a Greek blend to me. Ya know, because of the mountains and stuff. Just saying.

ofVbiJYT7yOgfN3YXZunDA.text: The food was a unique twist on classic cuisine, we had the shrimp appetizer which was fantastic, the chicken Cesar, salmon & chopped Kale and the beat salad. Everything exceeded expectations and was very unique & good! The customer service was exemplary as well.

8v8i2k2-MPnkRRwrEy5gSg.text: My friends and I wanted to grab a quick bite before we headed to the Mercury game, and decided it was finally time to try Arrogant Butcher since it is so conveniently located across from the arena. We dropped by during happy hour, which is valid dining at the bar or their communal table. There were 3 of us, the bar area was busy so we sat at the communal table. Our waitress was very friendly, helpful and efficient. She brought us HH menus as well as the regular menu and took our drink order a few minutes later. I got the fix, which is a rum based drink with fruit compote. It was very good, fruity and almost reminded me of lemonade. For food off the HH menu, we tried the smoked carnitas nachos, salmon and roasted pepper toast. The nachos were surprisingly really good, it was all about the cheese they used. Not your standard nacho cheese, and once all our chips were gone our waitress brought us more so we could finish off the cheese. The toasts were ok, they weren't toasted at all just a spread over bread with some toppings and too much cilantro. For our entree, we decided to get a half dozen oysters, king crab legs and a shrimp each. The oysters came with a choice of sauces, we opted for the jalapeno option and it was so good! That definitely made the oysters different than any other I've had. The shrimp was fine and crab legs were good with butter. Since we had more time to kill, we ended up agreeing to seeing the dessert menu and were quickly talked into trying their award winning salted caramel pudding. It was SO good! I was not expecting that at all. It tasted like salted caramel and had some whipped cream to cut the richness, but the consistency of the pudding reminded me more of a melted peanut butter than a liquid pudding.

photos.caption: Photo of The Arrogant Butcher - Phoenix, AZ, United States. King Crab Legs
Photo of The Arrogant Butcher - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Fix
Photo of The Arrogant Butcher - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Salted Caramel Pudding

cumSKYSWmoWaZb48nnlZog.text: Was a hotel recommendation and really enjoyed our overall experience. The bar was a bit chaotic for the amount of people the restaurant had in it, but drinks were well made (we had the polish fix and mule). Sat down quickly and server was great, offered lots of explanation and recommendation. The pretzel buns/fondue was epic and a huge portion.  Dinner was meatloaf and crab stuffed chicken, both AWESOME! We ended with some peanut butter pie which was just alright. We were enjoying everything else though so it didn't sway our experience either way.  Great experience, really great service, we'll be back!

photos.caption: Photo of The Arrogant Butcher - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of The Arrogant Butcher - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of The Arrogant Butcher - Phoenix, AZ, United States

_cnI6L-HlpIg2jPWfKo30w.text: Tonight was my Hubby's and I first time here after a Sun's game. I had the salmon which had a banging vinaigrette sauce and my husband had the crab stuffs chicken with a lemon caper sauce. Absolutely fabulous! The service was fantastic. The wait was only 15 minute which is not bad considering this restaurant is about a minute walk from the front of Talking Stick Arena. We'll definitely dine here again! Great comfort food and service.

photos.caption: Photo of The Arrogant Butcher - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of The Arrogant Butcher - Phoenix, AZ, United States

2sLJQcaKBcABYTu9Hzcr9Q.text: Wow. Fantastic dinner. If you are in downtown Phoenix you should definitely eat here. Everything is 5 stars - service, food, atmosphere. I would definitely suggest making a reservation.   I started with some brie cheese and cherry jam and deviled eggs - both really tasty.   For dinner, I had the scallops. Honestly some of the best I've ever had. And the sweet potatoes w crumbed bacon were delicious too.   For the desert the peanut butter cup was amazing. You have to like peanut butter - but if you do, get this.   Staff was excellent and timing of the food was perfect. Will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of The Arrogant Butcher - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Peanut butter awesomeness
Photo of The Arrogant Butcher - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Snake bite cocktail
Photo of The Arrogant Butcher - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Best scallops ever

FD3ya2itjKm_JKiiwNgANw.text: Way too expensive for small portions and mediocre food. Poor service. I don't like to pay for "trendy"

AseFNFAbAJhWSie1DZB39w.text: Overall pretty good.   I had the crab stuffed chicken but was a bit dry.   Service was slow too but I went in a party of six and this was a new place for all of us.   Not bad but not 5 stars either.   Prices were good.

S5XaUQ_eXhPF3Ok17yqC9Q.text: This place is a trap. Don't be fooled by the 4 stars and 2,000 plus reviews.  The foods was just okay. Nothing special.

x19wxU8MAjTb5cObk4i7Qw.text: This super busy restaurant is serving up delightful fresh food to the hungry masses. Super friendly and efficient service tops the modern industrial decor - big light shades, leather booths, wood and tile are some of the design features. Very tasteful colors and lighting.   We tried the cheddar cheese and some olives to start and paired nicely with a well made dirty martini. The berry compote was so good and complemented the sharp cheddar very well.  Their menu features steaks, seafood and salads. There were several exciting dishes I'd like to try but was hungry for something light so we built our own Caesar Salad with a delicious medium grilled salmon. It was the most amazing blend of lemon, grilled pepper and asparagus, and bright notes of some kind of parsley or something. It was really good.   To end the meal, we tried one of the blueberry cheesecake mason jars with a strudel crumble on the top. The blueberry topping was the same compote used in the cheese plate - not a bad thing! It was really delicious. The espresso I ordered with a lemon twist came in a nice tall clear highball sort of glass which was kind of different.   Great experience!

photos.caption: Photo of The Arrogant Butcher - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Blueberry Cheesecake - super yummy!
Photo of The Arrogant Butcher - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Grilled Salmon added to Caesar Salad

TKW3SUNjGquJyaid0Cq7SA.text: Cool decor and atmosphere. Great location in downtown Phoenix near the arena. It's pretty typical otherwise (the trendy meat/charcuterie thing).  Staff was so-so. Probably due to all the tourist or fan crowd. I might go back to the bar but not as likely to eat there again.

JRkZFrv8NUSI9VRVsUx6pQ.text: Was attending a conference @ Phoenix convention center and wanted to get out of there. Found this place on Yelp and it was just a short walk. Was with a group of 3 and we went during lunch. Without reservations they said our wait would be 30-40 minutes. We split up and sat at the bar. I had the steak chopped salad and it was delicious. Loads of avocado and fresh tomatoes along with a nice medium rare steak. It was delicious. I'd recommend this place and would definitely go back again. The menu had so many things I would like to try.

wRQXy-exoYBs6sYewHH_Hw.text: Dropped by for lunch and wasn't disappointed. The service was top notch and the food was awesome. I had the prime rib sandwich, my wife had the salmon and the kids had cheeseburgers all or which were tasty. I did not partake in adult beverages so I couldn't give you my opinion on the bar but it looked to have a nice selection of beer. This is a great place across from the suns arena!

UEhwxnvtBulHLamXpO2NtQ.text: Went in for dinner with some colleagues on a Wednesday evening. With no game at the Talking Stick that day we were hoping for a less busy evening. Nope! The place was busy and there were folks waiting outside to be seated. Thankfully we had reservations so we did not have to wait too long. The food was absolutely delicious. I had the Jambalaya and I tell you, it was even better than what I have had at NOLA. No kidding! The staff were super nice. We had a fun evening with good food and good company!

photos.caption: Photo of The Arrogant Butcher - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Jambalaya - Shrimp, Sausage, Chicken and Okra

Wq2HZ8M1x4zkPdj5vdGKtQ.text: My boyfriend and I had such a great time at the Arrogant Butcher on a busy Friday night. We sat at the bar and received excellent service by the bar tenders. My boyfriend had the beef stew and I had the beet salad. The beet salad was light and full of flavor, the perfect meal for a hot summer night. My bf enjoyed his stew. We also order a 1/2 lbs of crab legs. They were so good and our favorite dish of the night. We will definitely stop by the next time we are in town.

photos.caption: Photo of The Arrogant Butcher - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Libations
Photo of The Arrogant Butcher - Phoenix, AZ, United States. 1/2 lbs of Crab legs

5C3UKigE86M_6RJvYBTvvw.text: I have always known about The Arrogant Butcher but until recently had only ever been there once to meet for drinks, and it didn't stand out in my mind (not a bad experience but nothing amazing either). This past week we decided to come for a team lunch and I was completely surprised at how delicious my meal was! I ordered the green Chile beef stew and it tasted just like home (maybe even a little better with the fried egg on top). I generally avoid meals that are around $20 a plate but I definitely would go back for this! On top of that, the server was great and super attentive. I will know keep Arrogant Butcher in mind for my next dinner date night.

XIP3A5--YOAhBylx6d4thQ.text: Awesome place downtown. Always good service and food is great.   Was in on a Thursday night around 6 pm and not overly packed. Patio Jess open and they were lowering shades essentially to provide a bit of warmth. A group of us sat inside in a corner as we were reviewing a business meeting. The waiter was polite and understood we were going to be talking amongst ourselves a while so he was not pushy or rushing is to order.   I had the crab stuffed chicken with brussell sprouts. One of the better meals I have had in a while. Chicken was crispy and the crab was cooked well and very flavorful.   Always a great spot before a game for drink specials as well!

9-1UTDeGiWU2H6qosloFkg.text: Had lunch here and ate at the bar - really friendly staff. The bartender was very attentive and she suggested food and drinks that I may like. The Pink Drink was awesome. Don't order an appetizer if you plan to eat an entree - they are huge! I had the pretzels and fondue. Sooo yummy!

photos.caption: Photo of The Arrogant Butcher - Phoenix, AZ, United States

ufFUvVvWNjSRkdYO0XhXEA.text: Stopped in for lunch on a Thursday for my hubby's birthday and I can't believe how packed it was. I'm glad we had a reservation! We opted for drinks first - my husband had some bourbon on the rocks and I had a red wine. Both were delicious. Then we had the carnitas nachos which were waaaaay better than we were both expecting them to be! I highly recommend them and they're large enough to be a dinner or an app for 2-3 people to split. I had the grilled salmon and my husband had a salad. Only complaint with the salad was it came with croutons although that was not stated on the menu. Had it been, we would have asked for it without. The server offered to remake the salad but we just picked them off, which was fine. But the menu should be made more clear. The salmon was delicious. I could do without the Quinoa next time, which had a vinegar-sauce over it that I didn't love. But others may really enjoy it. Our service, despite how busy it was, was fast and the food came out really hot. Highly recommend this restaurant- we'll definitely be back.

kgs2E8LiumU9Rqn_SxBDhw.text: Great food, great atmosphere, great mojitos!!!!!  Menu is not overly long yet a good selection to choose from.  A definite spot to check out.

raqBVEpkL4XJ0Sx6KYndWw.text: Just wanted to try a new place for my birthday and was not disappointed. This place is nestled near the chase field stadium in downtown so be prepared for parking structures.   To start with the decor is very tasteful. I got seated with my party in one of their back rooms and the pictures on the wall were interesting.   Waiters and hostesses were on their game despite how busy it was. Not once did I feel like their wait staff was rude or ignoring our party.  For the food I am inclined to say that the appetizers did not disappoint. I ordered the pretzel bread with fondue and other people got the shrimp and nachos appetizers. None of them were below subpar each had its own unique flavor and look. The cheese especially with the pretzel bread had a soft taste and not overbearing. While the pretzel bread was unevenly salted on some and not other pieces the taste combined with the cheese was still fantastic.  Onto the main entrees, I was able to get the turkey pastrami and the prime rib French dip sandwiches. Both were visually appetizing and both had completely different tastes. The only bad thing I can say is the slight spice of the horse radish was not expected. As I am not a fan of horse radish this did not take away the tasteful meats in both sandwiches.  My number one place for salted caramel pudding now has a new champion. I can say hands down with the many places I have been able to get salted caramel pudding for dessert this is now my number one place. The sweet taste of caramel is neither overbearing nor is it underwhelming. The refreshing caramel taste with the whipped cream was a great balance.

photos.caption: Photo of The Arrogant Butcher - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of The Arrogant Butcher - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pretzel bread with cheese fondue
Photo of The Arrogant Butcher - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Salted caramel pudding

28Zr839yTYqkyroWwVfNwA.text: What a fabulous restaurant. I went here for my birthday and everything was great. The food, service, and atmosphere. Celeste was a fabulous server. Very informative and friendly. Their fish and chips were outstanding. Overall a wonderful experience.

TzTSWD3cf-EmagheKjbOpg.text: Had dinner here tonight and as usual it was wonderful. However I am vegan and it was not easy to figure out dinner for myself.  This is such a wonderful place I was really shocked that there were no vegan, vegetarian or gluten free options.  My friends all had a wonderful dinner and our service was over the top, the only thing you are short on is options for different eating styles.  I will keep checking back for additions to your menu.

8RVYsURfOYitEE4r76B-uw.text: Amazing food, excellent customer service. Our waiter made recommendations to us about the food and what was his favorite. The dinner tonight was delicious.  I had the filet and Marty had the meatloaf.

photos.caption: Photo of The Arrogant Butcher - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The pretzel bites with melted provolone.  Yummy.

W7lGqTKYMdwxerbOEvNFZw.text: The Arrogant Butcher treated me right. I was pleasantly surprised yesterday when my girlfriend took me here to surprise me for my 31st Birthday and that she did.   We had a table of 10 good friends enjoying different brews before deciding on our meal strategy. Before we could dabble into the Raw Bar we were greeted with two pretzel and cheese dishes. Apparently the secret was out that this was a birthday. So we carried on enjoying the pretzel and cheese and ordering oysters, shrimp and mussels. All which were tasty. The shrimp are enormous, the oysters about average and their Jalapeno Mignonette sauce was something that stood out for me. I could almost drink it, but I've got a thing for spice.   I decided to stick with the seafood theme and I ordered the New Zealand Sea Bass for dinner and it was tasty. Living in Florida the past 3 years has spoiled me with seafood compared to Arizona. With that said the price of the seafood was a little steep but the quality was there.  Everyone ordered something different and I tried a bite of each one... All were good. We also tried one of every dessert.... All were good!  I believe this is one of those places that you can't go wrong with. I will come back and thanks Arrogant Butcher for showing my group a good time.

Uhr9BwU67yuPv-g_vwyUCg.text: I had never been in before but had heard a lot about it from friends in the area. Finally made it in and was happy to see many of my favorites from the Fox Concepts there. They also have a pretty sweet Happy Hour- with serious deals on drinks and apps.   The ambiance was also great and had a great view of downtown Phx.   I enjoyed my pretzel bites, gin drink and delicious cheddar cheese appetizer!

0NchxIYiWo-mAFuLOm5P1Q.text: Amazing! I had great customer service and the food was soooooo good. I had the Grilled Salmon with Yukon Gold Potato, Roasted Mushrooms, Cipollini, Green Bean, Sherry Mustard Jus. Fresh, cooked to perfection. Loved it! If ever in down town Phoenix definitely make your way here.

LBfmILAoHbwCfE3NdvN97Q.text: Yummy and loved the pretzel bites and the kale salad! Definitely will get to this restaurant again when visiting Phoenix. They had outdoor seating which was fun in February for this Omahan:)

GHUi1ScVxBvVh72vssok-w.text: Lunchtime perfection! Walked there from my hotel & enjoyed a Santan shandy on the patio while waiting for succulent oysters, the beet salad (I swear there was no dressing & it was still amazing ) and brie with crusty bread & jam. Heaven.

rqspddaMOdnV1_wd7miYVw.text: The food was great but over priced. The fire alarm kept going off every 5 minutes for about 30 minutes. The staff was friendly and it was in a nice location. We went for lunch and got the Butcher's Platter. It was well worth it.

4Cge3fw0m8bFBSrX5yhu7Q.text: This place exceeded my expectations! The food was amazing and our waitress was outstanding! It was our one year anniversary and she brought us each a glass of campaign (on the house), as well as the amazing caramel apple pudding. The experience was awesome!

Bbx27-QLPVXuQOB8G4-wxw.text: Ordered some food. Food was ready right on time. It provided great customer service! You won't get cheated out with their toppings! They sandwich the goods between the cheese. We'll be back.

Y9yd6R3dA27pIgTu6lB0JA.text: Short rib stew was tasty! Service was mediocre to start but improved as the night went on.   I'd give it 3.5 stars if I could. Worth a visit.

4Mlr7t7FOk9wG5TtVpm77A.text: It was very busy and loud when we went. Our server was patient and explained the menu to us. Food was good and drinks were average.

rzF-tMD2u1jNkdiy-H1-pg.text: I never met this rumored arrogant butcher. But I did check this spot out for lunch with a group of 8 travelling coworkers. Had something called the Steak Cobb Salad and it was good. Large enough to make a meal.   A few others had the burger and it looked tasty as well.   This is a nice, spacious restaurant with a separate party room in the back.   Best of all? The name of the place is easy to remember.   Still never met any arrogant people the whole time...

afql_15ihjcbyZ3vuxwvCQ.text: Excellent food, good service, must try salted Carmel dessert.

M-PwrzlpdP0mC0ZVWP8-Og.text: Absolutely the best service. I was meeting up with my girlfriends from college. Our server Ian, was thorough, not overbearing, replaced our drinks when they were even only half full, made excellent suggestions. And then after dinner we were hanging out waaaay to long just talking, and instead of bugging us, brought a thoughtful dessert. Can't give enough stars. Thank you Ian.

3VypogWaAlFh4DFM8JLNgA.text: This was my first time here and my boyfriends second. We went on a Thursday night and had a reservation for 6:30  We were seated immediately in the bar area. Shortly after I came back from the restroom I found out we had to move tables because of a large party that walked in. To me, moving tables isn't a big deal especially since we just sat but they were extremely apologetic and the manager offered to buy us two appetizers and two drinks.   We ordered the mussels and the fried shrimp. And for drinks the daisy and the sexy gin and tonic. The mussels came out on a huge platter and looked overwhelming but it was the perfect portion. The shrimp was my favorite. It had a hint of sweetness to it, like they added honey or cinnamon to the recipe and the flavors complimented each other well. The daisy was delicious and my gin and tonic was refreshing.   For our entree my boyfriend ordered the steak and I ordered the sea bass. Portion wise, his was amazing. My bass came out and it was good but it didn't blow me away which is why I'm giving this place 4 instead of 5 stars. I excepted to be wowed since the dish was one of the pricer items. And the side dish it came with had me questioning what exactly I was eating.   Our server was very nice through out the meal and everything ran smoothly. Our bill would have been $120 but they ended up taking off $50 for the inconvenience.   I would definitely come back!

8IKuyL3XBYt9eUWxo4v18A.text: Slow cooked prime rib is amazing - happy hour is awesome! this is a must try!

42GTZDtxjN-7PKvJW85H-g.text: Reliably delicious Fox restaurant in downtown Phoenix. Similar to Culinary Dropout. Friendly waitstaff. Energetic atmosphere (but not to the point of obnoxious...it's a pleasant energy).  Always my go-to spot for grub when I'm in that part of town.

sF76SA3BxRCHJLcrWU8vBA.text: Love the pretzels!!!!! Every time I come to Arizona definitely this is the choice of place that I just dine.  Great pretzel and great environment.

VnmRMpbF2NSmqo1rkwPWNg.text: Headed downtown for a concert and decided to find a place nearby to have dinner. This place has been on my radar for awhile so it was an easy choice. We made a reservation for 6:15pm because we were unsure if it would be busy or not. Upon arrival it wasn't packed but definitely had a decent crowd. We got to pick if we wanted to sit inside or out and went with outside since it was so nice out.   Our waiter was attentive and friendly without being too chatty or interrupting us too much. He was on top of drink refills, providing steak knives, etc. Great service.   We started with the pretzels and provolone fondue since most reviews said they were awesome. They are indeed awesome. You get a ton of pretzel bites and there is plenty of cheese. It was a lot of two of us, but would be perfect for a group of 4-6. Highly recommend.   We tried a blackberry lemonade which was super tasty. Not fake flavoring and was just right. Definitely ask if they can do this when you are there if you like lemonades.   For our entrees, I went with the crab stuffed chicken and my girlfriend got the prime rib, which came with mashed potatoes. I thought the chicken was awesome. The crab added a great variety to the taste and the sauce was to die for. It was served on a bed of spinach which was also delicious. I would absolutely order this again!  The prime rib had good flavor, however it did come out pretty lukewarm. The potatoes were the same. She didn't want to deal with sending it back, so she just ate it, but that was the only downside to the meal. If it happened again I would probably insist she send it back!  The atmosphere was causal but sleek. The bathrooms were nice and clean and overall it was a really nice experience with great food for the most part. A solid choice!

photos.caption: Photo of The Arrogant Butcher - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Blackberry lemonade
Photo of The Arrogant Butcher - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of The Arrogant Butcher - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pretzel and cheese appetizer

xnSTzwZ886JPPkaW6shC9Q.text: I have always wanted to try this place and went here for a work event and was pleasantly surprised. So first off it is a prime location across the street from Talking Stick Arena Which makes it a busy place on game or event nights and higher parking fees. They do validate your parking for 2 hours if you park in the underground parking garage below the restaurant. Now onto the real important stuff the food , we did have a set menu so I couldn't choose exactly what I wanted but was happy with all the choices .  First off appetizers we had the house soft pretzels with provolone fondue which were great , as well as the spinach artichoke dip which was also really good. They also served smoked salmon toast which I didn't have but everyone seemed to like .  Then had a simple salad which was good , a little small but gotta save room for all the rest .  For entrees we had the Butchers Meatloaf which was amazing definitely a good choice as well as grilled salmon . I have included photos but unfortunately forgot the desert pictures. I will definitely be stopping by here again soon

photos.caption: Photo of The Arrogant Butcher - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shrimp , Chicken Sausage Jambalaya
Photo of The Arrogant Butcher - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Spinach Artichoke Dip
Photo of The Arrogant Butcher - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Smoked Salmon Toast

ULhTseYnBSIOKJjgib1o3A.text: I really wanted to love this place. While in PHX for a business trip, I was recommended The Arrogant Butcher from coworkers who had only read great views.  So I ordered the pretzel and fondue ($12) and was sickened by how much salt they use. The salt is essentially baked onto the pretzel making it near impossible to take off. The cheese tasted like any generic fondue.  For my entree I order the Jambalaya ($19) and was not impressed by the amount of food and dryness of the rice.  Overall, disappointed with taste and price. Costumer service was stellar and we liked the back area seating. It was quieter

photos.caption: Photo of The Arrogant Butcher - Phoenix, AZ, United States

ub8G_iJMzfULE0ndFqXU5g.text: We had a very large group in the bar area and ordered quite a few appetizers for the group. I spent most of my calories on the pretzels and beer cheese and shrimp. Could've used a broader selection of draft beers. Service was great for how big our group was.

TTJY-j_CcqHLGThn0eWN8w.text: I must say I was really impressed! From the warm customer service to the great seat at the chefs table. I had one of the best Gin and Tonic I've ever had!!! I also had goat cheese stuffed peppers which were simple but delightful and some buttermilk battered shrimp which were amazing. Can't wait to come back.

bJL3Rl7k1x8u0G7SopzPDg.text: Overall, great food and fun experience, just the bartenders were rude and POOR service.  Traveled to Phoenix with the boyfriend and wanted to stay local and close to downtown for a REALLY good dinner before we headed out to see the Horseshoe bend and Antelope Canyon the next day. And because of that, we wanted to make sure what we selected was one of the best since we didn't have much time in Phoenix. Yelped around and found this place and really happy we ended up here.  It was at a corner of downtown that was close by to the basketball stadium (Talking Stick Resort Arena). They had a great bar right in front of the restaurant for those who were waiting to be seated. We had to wait another 30 mins so we attempted to get 2 drinks by the bar. The ENTIRE 30 mins, we had NO service whatsoever so we finally gave up and that put us in a pretty grumpy mood but once we were seated, the servers were amazing! They recommended great dishes to us, we had a salmon dish and jambalaya, also a tray of FRESH oysters, YUM! Everything was great. We ended our night with dessert and that was awesome as well! It was a cheesecake but in a mini masor jar and the crust was really delish!

photos.caption: Photo of The Arrogant Butcher - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of The Arrogant Butcher - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of The Arrogant Butcher - Phoenix, AZ, United States

JSuog8BcFmm6z1B5WhmIAg.text: Okay so I've been here twice now with my boyfriend - two weekends in a row lol. This place is phenomenal - from the food to the atmosphere. The first time we went I ordered scallops, that came served over the most delicious creamed corn and were maybeee the best I've ever had. Second time around I ordered the prime rib French dip - which was also one of the best hot beef sandwiches I've ever tasted (and I'm from Chicago so I know something about a good hot beef sandwich lol). Keep up the good food/service! We will definitely be back :)

Dg7puajEDhoYmdDPcxcmLA.text: Just popped in for drinks before concert.  Standing room only but got to the bar to order at least.   Drinks were great.   Not a super comfortable experience,  but not the fault of restaurant. Just super busy.  Would like to check them out again in greater detail sometime.

9wY_P6aheJYICtpn63QYwg.text: I hope this doesn't come across as negative.  This is a really fun restaurant with sports on tv, nice and fun waiters and a great atmosphere.  My ratings are primarily food oriented and here is absolutely passable but the cuisine isn't special.  I would stay away from the pasta and any dish that requires finesse.  The prime rib was very good but not as tender as you would get at Capital grille or a True steak house.  Order stuff like simple meat, fish 'n chips and you'll have a great time.  They also tried to keep the prices down.  A bottle of delicious Merlot or Cabernet costs $32 a bottle which is darn good.  Come here for fun, laughs and hearty food.

photos.caption: Photo of The Arrogant Butcher - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Atmosphere is fun and lively.  Great waiters.
Photo of The Arrogant Butcher - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cuisine absolutely passable but not special.

xAce7WiO_FnPoEBUF6Lb4g.text: My husband was given some gift cards to the Foxx Concepts restaurants awhile back. We have been on a mission ever since to find the restaurants we thought we'd most enjoy and put it on our never ending bucket list of places to dine at. I am to say the least happy with our decision to  try out The Arrogant Butcher especially with a name like that it could've easily been a confusing experience. The selections of appetizers to entrees were far from confusing and rather simple to navigate.  I'm starting to notice a trend here as the the other Foxx concepts place we tried was The Culinary Dropout and they both sorta had the same feel to them. Every dish we tasted was served hot fresh and quickly yet, simple with an original twist to each. As you can tell from the many different angles of pictures of my flourless Chocolate lava cake it was my favorite. Although, I do have to mention the charcuterie board came in close second as I've never had one before and still need some more experimenting. I thank Chef Ina Garten for introducing me to the lovely boards from watching her videos on Instagram and Tiffany Amber Thiessen who also put together some beautiful displays of cheese, crackers and meats, etc. From start to finish all the staff were friendly and very attentive. We were constantly getting our water refilled by our waitress. The busser's were so fast at cleaning up our table for the next guest that when I accidentally forgot my truffle crescenza and bread to go it was already thrown out by the time I got to the door and walked back for it. I was so sad. Oh well it just gives me and excuse to go back for more.  Don't do like we did and parked in the wrong parking garage. Although, we enjoyed the walk through all the construction going on it would have been much easier to have parked in the garage right underneath the place.

photos.caption: Photo of The Arrogant Butcher - Phoenix, AZ, United States. This was delicious the Charcuterie Board
Photo of The Arrogant Butcher - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Deep fried breaded Crispy Shrimp
Photo of The Arrogant Butcher - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lovely restrooms

nhvaLnGowRxCfLpx3cYZAw.text: Excellent food and service! Long wait due to conference in Phoenix. Very accommodating for dietary restrictions and food was well prepared and delicious! Wait staff was very attentive and helpful with menu. It was difficult to get water at the bar while waiting and a water station might have been nice as it was 112* plus outside and no place to wait. Our food was not mushy or soggy. We had the enchiladas and filet. Both were cooked perfect and not over seasoned. Enchiladas had a little too much sauce but this was easily removed. Overall good experience despite how busy it was and the variable reviews.

HmAhaS045fpVHwudTjAVcA.text: On our way out of town, I found this restaurant, of course, on Yelp. And, based on the convenience of the location, we gave it a go.  Thank goodness we were on our way back home because nothing we ordered was good.  One item in particular was the buffalo wings. We specifically asked if they were crunchy and the waitress assured us they were ... NOT! Mushy and soggy!  Don't waste your time!

dzdZbPqlw3XNJGzBCNWV6A.text: I traveled 20 miles from my office to near my wife's office as she invited me for lunch on my birthday. She took me to this restaurant and indeed it was best selection.   Quality food , quality ambience and good time together. Must try crispy chicken thighs appetizer. Don't come without eating it. Also we took fish and chips. Their courtesy that they plated it for us and we felt like they brought 2 quantity of order for us. Good service as well. Must place to visit in phoenix downtown.

p_I8Htcx6UNYzcok7smqPg.text: I was in the mood for something downtown and this restaurant has been popping up on my searches for a long time! I thought it was finally time to give it a try! The prime rib was pretty thick and cooked exactly how I wanted it. My friend has the jambalaya which looked amazing too! Their menu seemed a little random which means it would probably cater to anyone's craving. They also have good local beers which was a huge plus.   Side note: if you love people watching be sure to sit outside. We came during comic con and it was epic!  Parking: there's a parking garage attached to this building and the restaurant validates! Free parking for 2 hours!

photos.caption: Photo of The Arrogant Butcher - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Slow Roasted Prime Rib with mashed potatoes

eeVVSf8ghV1Qqga1dI5VdA.text: After seeing yelp reviews mentioning steak, and then craving said steak, I ended up here.  To my surprise there was no steak, but it was the lunch menu, so no big deal, I ended up getting the tuna poke bowl. Fresh, colorful, great dish.  We came back for dinner to try the filet mignon along with fried shrimp that were both excellent. The filet was maybe a bit overkilled with the red wine sauce but still was cooked perfectly.  One of my favorite places I tried in Phoenix.

gEBIQ54KJ3Pfs4UJ-3qs8A.text: With a unique and fun menu, the food choices were great. I had my heart set on beef so I settled on the 12oz prime rib. My friend had the crab stuffed chicken Brest. We were both amazed at the great flavor and portions.   What highlighted the dining experience was dessert. Be sure to order the sticky toffee cake with a coffee flavored whip cream. It was sensational.   The Arrogant Butcher should be a place on your list when visiting downtown Phoenix!

photos.caption: Photo of The Arrogant Butcher - Phoenix, AZ, United States

BK5xoEu1D9jpnRcObMX4Zg.text: I chose this for my birthday meal during our 3 day trip to Phoenix. The pretzel and cheese fondue appetizer was a fantastic way to start the meal! The entrees themselves were good, but not great. We ordered the short rib stew, the salmon with deviled eggs side, and my son got the buffalo chicken thighs appetizer for his entree. The drink menu was good, but the atmosphere was a bit pretentious. If I went again I would focus on their cheese/charcuterie selections.

PVLGB_Y8N4YK74Dd8ayibA.text: Update  May 2019 (exactly 1 year later) I wanted to give this place a 2nd chance and it did me good and earned an extra star. For starters. I had learned that the person that was killing the mood last year was no longer there. Meaning, I got to enjoy my meal in peace.  This time I went with the Slow Cooked Prime Rib and Smashed potatoes that far exceeded my expectation. Thank you to Brent for his recommendation and service for the night.  Still bummed this place closes early...I got there 30min earlier than last year... All in all, great food, great staff, hours could use an extra push (too used to San Diego life)  I HIGHLY RECOMMEND!  May 2018 A couple reasons why this place didn't get 5 Stars...  1. Hours of operation. This restaurant clearly resembles a bar like atmosphere, however having the huge bar in the middle, it does not stay open late. Week nights 9pm and Weekend 10pm close time.   2. The excitement put off from the person who looked like he was a manager of some sort, definitely killed the vibe by hounding the kitchen staff about completing orders in a timely manner. The restaurant was not slammed at all and the staff was moving quick as it is. I came here upon recommendation and after hearing the excitement put off, it definitely killed the experience.   Don't get me wrong tho, the food was delicious! I went with the Fish Tacos being that the kitchen was "closing" and I wanted to be mindful of the staff. And the Bartender fixed me a nice Jameson and Pineapple which complimented my dinner.   Will I go back? Yes I most likely will and not around closing time

photos.caption: Photo of The Arrogant Butcher - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Prime Rib w/Smashed Potatoes
Photo of The Arrogant Butcher - Phoenix, AZ, United States

qJitPMomTq_JXqOiEvtkrw.text: The name does not represent the fare. The "Butchers Platter", aka charcuterie, was good, but beyond that...nope. Caesar salad dressing was the worst I've ever had, and shrimp was over cooked. (I wanted a steak, but none on the menu...#butcher?)   The service was AWESOME though, and the reason I gave three stars. Hostesses were sweet and my waitress was amazing and so attentive.  Probably won't return.

64Wan4_tcQgPjq_eas1j_Q.text: So, I've lived at cityscape a bit over two years and this is my second time going to the Arrogant Butcher. Tonight's visit reminded me why I hadn't gone back in over a year. First, I have to say the bartender was nice once he opened up a bit, but when you have 5, maybe 6 taps, and someone walks up the bar and asks what you have, don't say "look here on the menu (paraphrase)". Good tip comes from interacting with patrons immediately as they come up. I ordered the prime rib with Mac and cheese. I found out that he was allergic to gluten so couldn't really help for the sides. I asked for medium rare, and saw some decent pictures online. Nope, what I got was clearly well done and hacked to death. The weight had to be wrong, which means whoever is managing quality control is ok sending out crap. (See pic). The bartender noticed and took it back and brought me a much better cut. Not the best prime rib, definitely mediocre after the experience. Particularly for $33, I could have been happier with Outback. Again, not the bartenders fault at all. He offered a dessert or beer for free, I declined both. He may have removed a beer tho, I didn't bother looking. I left as soon as I'm done. I'm afraid this place is exactly what it's named, "arrogant butcher". Here's the point, sure they offered a comp, but here's how you get a better rating, don't fuck it up the first time.   Tip - don't expect anything of quality or wow near two sport arenas.

photos.caption: Photo of The Arrogant Butcher - Phoenix, AZ, United States. $33.00 medium rare roast beef - returned. Maybe 10 oz at best.

k8WnIF6Xdai_DGr4MrnryA.text: hostess was a royal b. went there tonight - she informed us in a rather rude manner it would be a 45 minute wait with at least 10 tables visibly open inside and 30 tables open outside. she seemed overwhelmed and it felt like she wanted us to walk away. ny strip was 36 dollars and a guest leaving said it was not even worth 12. there had to be at least 50 people huddled around bar area and place looked chaotic and poorly  run.

f1cJOEcGmA02HUrrn_cpDw.text: I stopped in for a drink and a quick bite but after the service I was receiving I decided to only order a drink (one more min of being ignored I would have walked out ordering nothing). I sat at the bar, which wasn't busy considering there was only 2 other people sitting there at the time,and the 2 bartenders were too busy talking to each other to check the area to see if new people were sitting down. After about 3 min of being ignored, another person sat down. Because this person sat closer to the bartenders peripheral , she got served within 1-2 min. Finally after the bartender took her order and was starting to prepare her drink she noticed me, By then the damage of waiting 5 min had been done. It is not for me to get their attention, it is for them to not have conversations with their backs fully turned to their station so they can notice if they have customers in need.

hF38uZc_ked5zHfqo4Fu2g.text: Location, decor, service were all very good. We were asked if we had reservations at lunch time (which we didn't) but we were able to be immediately seated inside at a long table with other parties. We started with the pretzels and fondue which was tasty but not unique. I went with the charcuterie board with hot coppa and montchevre with a side of grilled asparagus. Again, all good but not unique. Prices were moderate. I think the drink menu was longer than the food menu. I probably wouldn't go out of my way to return here but certainly wouldn't avoid it.

QVbC6dCyT4v6La-bsHhOCQ.text: After a 20 minute wait on a busy night with a convention in town we were seated and our drink order came out quick. Our waitress helpful. I had the surf and turf filet with lobster topping. Perfectly cooked and delicious. Others ordered ribs and carnitas. Both enjoyed their meals. Wait staff was attentive. The atmosphere was fun and the patrons happy and having fun. Good vibe. This is a good "go to" in downtown. Here I think you will get your moneys worth. Our primary waitress got the orders to us fine but seemed to be having a bad night.

c3q9ro3E4L6oRglosxvkqQ.text: Pretty delicious. Cool atmosphere. Great location. A tad pricy and not too many menu options but the quality was good and the flavors were delightful.

7J3swG3oMdGYuUCIgFsfRw.text: Great place and cool staff!  Cool atmosphere too.  Always good to know another great downtown spot!  Sit at the food bar!  The cooks are so awesome to talk to and you always have people taking care of you!  Crab legs are amazing too!!!

sRz9SYbzNyD00QrSRe5Q9g.text: I came here for the first time for my birthday today and I do not have one single complaint. Everything was incredible. The two waiters were absolutely kind and timely with all our requests. They recognized my birthday and brought out my desert with a candle. We ordered a salmon salad, salmon entree, and chicken entree which were all top of the line good, and I have been to extremely good restaurants and this has definitely topped them. The food was fresh, perfectly seasoned and the service was more than kind.

A69mX0rsoW8nG3ThsxBwEg.text: It was my first time and probably my last.  I went here for my birthday dinner and we ordered:  Pretzel Bites, Crab Stuffed Chicken, Sloppy Joe burger, Mussels, and Beef Stew.  I was not impressed.  The pretzel bites with the cheese fondue was just that.  Pretzel bites that were pretzels you can probably get at the mall or even at softball game in smaller pieces.  The crab stuffed chicken was a chicken sandwich!  Two chicken filets as the bread and the crab in the middle.  It was not good.  The sloppy joes was ok, but can't distinguish if it is better than any other sloppy joe burger i've tried before.  The beef stew and the mussels were forgettable.  I was pretty disappointed to have spent my birthday here..Happy Birthday to me.

soF0Sp8BRYXRbAiqgyqeyw.text: What a special  treat!   I came here with 3 of my friends and our server was so friendly, prompt and positive.   I had soup and a side house salad. The soup had bacon flavor and was just amazing.... I wish I could remember the name of it because I seriously want to go back and have more.   I highly recommend this place to anyone!

iCitVpXTLX5PktGgXSLwjA.text: We went for lunch on Saturday afternoon and sat at the chef's counter. Service was great all around, but Nick was exceptional. He was friendly and helpful. We ordered the Butcher's Platter and cheesecake for dessert. Yum! Will definitely be back!

xHIANmiK3YqjuUJ2YVpYEQ.text: Spot on flavor and technique. Limited sampling of: 1. Roasted Tomatoes side - I had this as a starter and it was a perfect tease...right-sized portion and a tomato that combines the sweetness of a sundried tomato and the juiciness/flavor of a tomato that perfectly balances fresh and concentrated flavors. 2. Scallops - smoked cauliflower, peas, nuts and oranges...incredible balance of citrus, smoke and crunch that is all ridiculously fresh letting the flavors work.  If you like technicality the scallops were a  single-side sautee and were PERFECT!    Sorry for long review, I think I enjoyed it!

_wpBPP8s2MI0LHraxENMbg.text: Oh my goodness....worth the drive to downtown Phoenix. The server was super sweet and helpful.... the food was incredible!  We will definitely return!!

nh-CgKxcBFYKKecUNNSPzA.text: We were in town for a couple of days and looking for a bite on Saturday night.  After we checked online and saw no available reservations, we called and they told us that since it was a huge tourist weekend (the last of spring training), they were holding most of their tables for walk-ins.  So we headed down and were quoted a wait of 15-20 minutes.  Off to the bar!  The place seemed pretty packed and buzzing.  A couple of local brews later, our table on the patio (as requested) was ready.  Service was perfectly friendly and helpful.  We shared a plate of ham, mustard and bread to start.  I had the sloppy joe, my boyfriend had the pastrami sandwich.  Food was solid, but short of phenomenal.  It's a fairly curated menu considering the size of the place.  You know where you see 6-7 options that sound just okay but nothing that sounds like "OH MY GOD I HAVE TO EAT THIS NOW"?  That was pretty much my feeling towards their offerings - hence the sloppy joe.    Only hitch was that I ordered a glass of wine and wound up getting charged for a bottle - a fact I didn't catch until I reviewed the receipt the next day.  But I gave them a call today and the management happily agreed to refund the difference.  (Thanks guys!)  I was happy with their selection of wines by the glass - they seem to make a point of serving some of the less available varietals.    We don't come to Phoenix much, so I'm not sure we'll be back.  But if you're staying downtown or attending something at the US Airways Center, this is a good option for an easy bite.

pL77XmmQiZAIuw99_tvHCg.text: Start with the pretzels.  Pastrami sandwich is outstanding.

OAJ4DWNYrQgc9qeJPL34_w.text: I wish I could do half stars. Arrogant Butcher is good, but not great. It's consistently good food with good drinks. It also has a good atmosphere. But that's it. Good, good, good. I would never pick Arrogant Butcher as a place I definitely want to go to. It's also a bit overpriced.  I've only ever had salads. The Market Salad is quite tasty. Although, it seems to have spaghetti in it. Not the grain I was expecting. The Chinese Chicken Salad is just ok; it needs more spice. The pretzel balls are legit.  They provide speedy service, and I really appreciate that, especially at lunch time. They're also very accommodating of groups.  I'm curious to try out their happy hour.

vGvlwie_rCeHGTnzfa7p9w.text: We had a nice long debate about whether to give this place 3 or 4 stars (from an account that has given 5 stars to pho places in the avenues). In the end, it came down to how well the restaurant met EXPECTATIONS.  If you have been to Tucson, for example. a very comparable restaurant is Hub. Similar atmospheres and rich, hearty, flavorful foods. But that place is in crappy Tucson so, pretty much having some edison bulbs down there scores you a 5 star review on the 'hip vibe' alone. But Arrogant Butcher is in downtown Phoenix and has nearly 300 reviews around 4 stars. One should EXPECT more than the typical Fox template.   The decor and service is excellent as expected.  However, the letdown came when, after enjoying the hummus plate and pretzel fondue, the angus cheeseburger came to the table. Good but so far below expectations. With all the other great items on the menu, they should have just axed the forgettable burger plate (or improve it to Zinburger status).   Also, be aware that they stop taking reservations 48 hours in advance. So, though our wait on a Saturday night was only about 15 minutes, you may want to plan ahead.

wIQXEKjEQ8IeObSi8kUOlg.text: this place is the best place ever. its pricey but its worth every single dollar. best filet in town and strong cocktails

mbqQTGzjaP3D0WYePpdwow.text: Sorry for some that didn't have the same experience but this place is great... Had all appetizers, pretzels, eggs, shrimp, oysters, and salmon rillette - unreal. Service was top notch as well.

z9tFvC798sC8AXDDL8uI2A.text: My girlfriend and I went there on a Saturday night recently and must say that we really enjoyed the experience.   Our server was very friendly and made some excellent suggestions based up our tastes.    Yes, it is a little pricey but I firmly believe that you get what you pay for.  The ambiance was very cool and the food was quality.  I got the bbq ribs and I must say that they were delicicious.    Make reservations as it can get pretty crowded.

fPpWLn9NYPSbexM7DXQ0Gg.text: My mom and I came here prior to a local event for lunch. The staff were very friendly and helpful as it was our first time trying their restaurant. We had the BLT with fries which was amazing! My mom ordered the salted caramel pudding. It was very filling and the perfect consistency. I gave the experience a 4 star because the seating was awkward. We sat on the side by the bar where one side a was a booth and the other were single chairs. The chairs were several inches higher than the booth so it was a bit uncomfortable. Other than that, it as a great first experience.

Tm6f0qvzpRb6NxG1malEjw.text: I absolutely love this place. I had the gin and tonic #8 and it was one of the tastiest drinks ive ever had. For food I had the beef short rib stew w/ egg and then the caramel dessert. All of it tasted incredible.

cPcm7gDqr5de1piMiTqS6w.text: Hamburger was burned on the outside and cold on the inside, and even the buns were burned. The service was bad. We couldn't get anyone to help us. I asked for ketchup 3 times from 2 different people. It was a really simple request, but it never came.   Poor service & poor food. I wouldn't go back. I was really disappointed.

x3yUt96E7zVs-o8RZTdOgg.text: Great happy hour.....bufflo chicken tighs great tasting. Stop by before flying back to Dallas

aSr3r0jFfPmocAK2blL4jw.text: The filet was one of the best I have ever had. It was served on top of very rich and delicious creamed spinach. I was certainly impressed and would recommend to anyone.

GtJhcRW_ClBwIdE3kCZCmw.text: Food was good. I recommend the peanut butter cup for dessert. The meat and cheese board was also enjoyable. Decent atmosphere.

3nLz3EZ0qSRp4wyCc0WXzw.text: This is not the best of Michael Fox's restaurants.  The food is just "ok".  The location is pretty central for any type of downtown event.  However, I have tried this place a few times and have never been blown away by the quality of the food.  The service, however, is good.

s_D4kpAzQ_fhnrfjvDsPeQ.text: I have always loved this place.  The pretzel appetizer is the bomb.  We ordered that and another appetizer.  I always get the salmon entree.  Not sure what is called on the menu.  It comes with little potatoes and a good sauce.  I have never had any of their desserts and might have to try one next time.

FoYiWEFNLZauFFUTOIEmiw.text: The restaurant was over priced and not a good experience. The food was cold and the portions were very small for the price. The staff was not willing to help and not knowledgeable about the food they had. My wife and I have wanted to try this place for a long time but was a horrible let down. Would not recommend this restaurant to anyone. If you want good American food good somewhere else.

XzYY5ds8fOyXqMHsWDGGYQ.text: We wanted a place to have a drink and a meal before the suns game in talking stick arena; this place was perfect!  Great food perfect mixed drinks; fun atmosphere!  And a short walk to the game

P72FyRMLT_9QNPKAsyJ_4g.text: The ambiance is great! Fantastic lights hanging from the ceiling. I had the beet salad and it was perfect. My daughter had the Chinese chicken salad. Both were dressed perfectly. Not too much or too little-usually I ask for the dressing on the side so it's not over dressed but forgot to here. No worries it was perfect! Service was great also!

yXVzU1HdyN0CMJyfCqSuLA.text: Went for my bro in laws bday- Drinks where great. Got a bunch of different appetizers to share with table and a salad- EVERYTHING was good. Came on a busy Saturday night and they worked hard to get us in quick.

oUGGSZ1Ps22aL-9chsVd3g.text: Great food,  we had the hamburger and the beef short ribs, both were excellent.  The short ribs were in a green chili sauce with a sunnyside egg on top.  The poblano peppers added just the right amount of heat and flavor.  They have a decent beer selection as well.

Z1N6JPgkv6TTrSb_wynFUg.text: While the most of the reviews of this place are stellar, I was a bit disappointed with my visit here.  The place has an interesting atmosphere. The restaurant is like an upscale diner with a trendy bar area.  I was here with a group from a conference I was attending here. We had a 45 minute wait when we arrived at 8pm so we started at the bar. The bartender seemed a little put off when we asked to sample the craft beer options.For me the draft options were just ok. The Deschutes IPA was the best of the bunch and at least I've had it before so I knew what I was getting into.  When finally seated at our table, we ordered a few appetizers - the pretzels with provolone cheese, the shrimp, and the zucchini fritters. The shrimp was the best of the bunch with a spicy coating. The fritters were second best but the pretzels were a disappointment. They were like pretzel rolls and huge with no real flavor. Same with the cheese. Smaller bites may have made them more enjoyable.  For an entree, I ordered the sea bass which came with barley and arugula. The fish was good and I enjoyed the crispy edges but the barley was too salty portion size was quite tiny.   The best thing about this place to me was our server who was great with explaining specials, her favorites, and refilling drinks. But when you hit a restaurant, you expect the food to stand out and it did not for me.  I'd give this place a 3 1/2 but not quite worthy of the 4th star.

sbW4vQ7HlTEYcO_-xKr3BA.text: Finally a GREAT restaurant in Downtown Phoenix, AZ! Matter of Fact a MUST destination Restaurant on your Bucket List! Great Food, Fun Ambiance and one of the best Downtown Phoenix restaurants On The Road Eats has been to!  A menu loaded with some great Appetizer, Soup, Salad, Sandwich and Entree options. With a Culinary twist your going to love! What Ala Carte King Crab Legs....served with choice of cocktail sauce, remoulade, or jalapeno mignonette WHO DOES THAT!  Huge bar and fun ambience inside, but the Patio is where its at! But Chef it's AZ and super hot out! Hold the heat, Arrogant Butcher has misters and it is super comfortable even in the middle of summer. (Patio dining is one of my faves, so thanks Arrogant Butcher for looking out for us Outdoors Foodies)  Have you ever ordered Nachos and said where is the meat, wait where is the flavor? Not at The Arrogant Butcher...the SMOKED CARNITAS NACHOS - super good and full of flavor, and a good size portion for an appetizer - "To Go Box Please"!  Now for the Amazingness...BEEF SHORT RIB STEW Green Chile, Fried Egg, Cornbread! I know right, this dish could go either way Good or Bad. All I can say is SUPER GOOD! WIN WIN...The Crispy Shrimp and the  CHARCUTERIE & CHEESE are a must!  THANK YOU THE ARROGANT BUTCHER FOR FILLING A NEED IN DOWNTOWN PHOENIX, AZ FOR US FOODIES! FUN, FRIENDLY AND AMAZING FOOD WILL KEEP ME AND MY FELLOW FOODIES COMING BACK FOR MORE ~ Chef Approved-CHEF GREG REILLY

Photo of The Arrogant Butcher - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Forget about inside the Patio is where its at!

YVXgJMlgw3wCB3k6Tj-hWQ.text: What a great treat for a date night.  Started off with the prosciutto deviled eggs and boy were they awesome. Super creamy yellow with truffle oil blended in for the final touch. Entree we had Meatloaf and the AB Cheeseburger.  With the meatloaf they made sure the meat was start of the show. Super tender and a great blend of meat/veggies.  Mashed potatoes were nice and creamy with a light gravy in the middle.  The cheeseburger had a sharp but not sour flavor.  Burger was cooked to perfection but was a little undersized for the bun. However the bun was delicious.    Will come back again to try more. You won't be disappointed you came.

93TgMFSuAYwpgZJNHg1hZw.text: My experience at the Arrogant Butcher has been nothing short of amazing. I've ate there three times and each experience has been unique (eating by myself v. With family and friends). The food is fantastic and their staff is exceptionally knowledgeable regarding both food and the wine menu. In all, their staff and the product they provide constantly remain top quality and I look forward to visiting them again.

wEXpg_1ZvUrqHZMopLYc-g.text: I'd give this place six stars if I could.  Filet mignonette, sauteed mushrooms and creamed spinach? I'm in heaven. You must try The Arrogant Butcher. Amazeballs. Seriously the best meal I've had in a very long time. kudos. Love, Lara

C0Gk8Ggej1wOgybRCNGHtA.text: Chicken thigh appetizer was ok. Not what I expected, too much breading for my liking.

9bwma1_sRRV5OS_2QpoYPQ.text: I cannot say enough good things about this amazing Fox restaurants concept. The food was outstanding. There's really nothing else to say about it.  The bartender was incredible, and the overall experience left me giddy. In short... eat here. And have the house-made mustard. You must.

_MUBpbEb4CZXQvITLt_QAg.text: This place is awesome. Great food and great service. Went here Saturday night and had the prime rib with potatoes. It was the best tasting prime rib I've ever had. I love coming back here. Never dissapoints

2jttHCdGv-KxLDOSXcBITg.text: Last night we had exceptional service and food. Dining with a toddler isn't always easy, but they made it a wonderful experience!  For apps, we enjoyed the nachos, zucchini fritters and pretzel fondue. Everything was delicious. For dinner, we had fish and chips and the ribs. Both were amazing. But the service was the best! Thank you Brian!

ouVYNJw-C8iPtiGMNmrnOw.text: I've been wanting to go to The Arrogant Butcher ever since it opened, and, well, it took me more time than I'd like to admit before I finally made it there.  But, sometimes waiting makes the outcome that much better, and, boy, was the outcome fantastic.    Thankful I was with someone who is a regular, and who knew how to navigate us through the delicious menu. (Although, I didn't need much guidance as I had been eying their beef short rib stew since I first peeked at their online menu).  We started first with appetizers, and had a great sample of what they offered: the rock shrimp and the pretzel & fondue were amazing.  I couldn't stop eating the pretzel & fondue -- I was afraid I wouldn't have enough room in my tummy for my meal... but of course I would.  And I almost did. The beef stew was so delicious, and even though I was kind of weirded out by the friend egg on top (I know foodies die for that stuff), I gobbled up almost every morsel until my tummy just couldn't hold any more.  And throughout it all, I was sucking on one of their specialty cocktails recommended to me by a coworker -- The Polish Fix.  It was quite good, but very strong, and I was feeling it even with all the food I was eating.  All in all, a great treat for my senses. It is in a great location -- right on the corner of 2nd St. & Jefferson, and if you chose to eat outside in the cooler months, or inside facing the wall of windows, you'll be guaranteed a great people watching opportunity.  I can't wait to go back and try some of their other menu items.  I'm glad I waited, but now I can't get enough of that arrogant butcher!

8prFomdei64YC9RWtXat4w.text: This place is awesome!!! My husband and I have been here about 4 times and every time has been amazing. We only sit at the "Raw Bar" when we come. The guys behind the raw bar are so personable and make your visit special each time. They are actually one of the main reasons we keep coming back. I love this place, and we will continue coming back and telling others.

2dMtx-kovb-JzChQA7NuWw.text: We tried Arrogant Butcher for the first time on Saturday for Happy Hour. There was a 30 minute wait which was reasonable considering the activity downtown.  The hostess seated us and was pleasant. We were greeted immediately by our waitress. She took our drink order and explained the menu.  I thought the cocktails were priced good for Happy Hour. I had the Turkey Pastrami sandwich and my wife had the beet salad. I thought the sandwich was cooked perfectly and the fries were hot and crispy. My wife enjoyed the salad but commented that the bowl was too deep and the nuts and dressed stayed on the bottom. We felt the price was right and the atmosphere was great. We look forward to trying other options from the menu.

pHHULkiIBejiwlMLVK4ghw.text: Pricey but yummy!!  Always good service no matter how busy. Good wine selection and excellent food!!

uV1kK0bGUfSyHMryG3yTVQ.text: I had the grilled chicken tabbouleh salad and it was very delicious! The relaxed lunch atmosphere is great.

IdJixjG3333_wxqUeBtP8A.text: This may have been the most average burger I have ever had. Came in on a Saturday night at 6 and was seated almost right away. The pretzel fondue was pretty good and we ate all of that. My burger on the other hand was awful, I didn't even finish it. I was surprised considering this is a Fox restaurant and I love their other spots.

-uz9ps2nQpJ5aLsoM6g61g.text: First time and last time here. We went for happy hour but didn't know we had to tell the hostess we want to sit in the happy hour section. Waited twice for a table. Pretzel bites were great and a good value. Antipasta plate did not have much on it for the $8 spent. I had the mule. Very disappointing since we had just left Bitter & Twisted and had amazing cocktails there, only to come here for a sugary pre made drink mix. With so many great places to go downtown, we won't be back.

tIVL-vh3Cu48-Fjdzodsmg.text: I ordered the pork carnitas.  The dish came out barely warm and the pork was very dry.  Overall the dish lacked flavor and was very disappointing.

gcT_rlXF8EBmQEiAv67iUg.text: We've been here twice now and both times were very pleasant. You have to get the pretzel fondue - its amazing. It is basically what you always dreamed of when ordering a pretzel and cheese sauce at the ball park - only this time the cheese dip is amazing and flavorful and the pretzel is moist and perfectly warm. For dinner we had the crab stuffed chicken which was very good and the Bolognese with Ricotta Dumplings. This dish was amazingly good - unfortunately it had been removed from the menu for some reason by the time we got back for our second visit.   The second visit was to kill an hour before taking friends to the airport. We got an assortment of beers and appetizers - all were good especially the rock shrimp, the bacon and cheese stuffed potato bites (not the real name) and of course the pretzel fondue again. We sat on the patio and the open atmosphere was great. Highly recommend as a change from the usual fare.

yzX7_1tUMRuY5ChPMmBslw.text: I really don't get all the hype this place gets, I was totally underwhelmed.  Very expensive and not very good.  I ordered a burger and the patty was so thin it looked like something that would come from McDonald's.  I have to admit the salted caramel desert was very good, but that's about it.

Y3sPhB92zpJFAzS9TAoJSQ.text: Charcuterie plate was awesome, and dinner was just as good, with a lively ambience, would definitely come again!

zUdKVzscJ3lmcNJzh5Gplg.text: The food was ok...once we got past the rude host at the front (maybe the maitre d'  - a tall guy with a mustache & little beard). We arrived at 3:52 pm on a Tuesday. The restaurant was nearly empty. There were 7 of us with 3 more coming. The host asked if we had reservations, we said no, we'd been at an event & were going to the game.   He said he couldn't seat us as there were others who DID make reservations. (yes, he said it as if it were in CAPS!) We had to ask if the patio (which is huge & has misters) was available - yes. Then we asked if we could have a table inside if we promised to be gone by 5. He reluctantly agreed.  When my wine arrived, there was an insect in it. Our. Waiter was nice & replaced it.  The food was decent - we just had salads & appetizers. I had the Antipasta which was very small, and only came with 2 small pieces of bread. It did come with tart cherry preserves which were great.  A friend had the Tabbouli salad, which was ok, and another had the Salmon Rillette which was good. The food was ok, but nothing to write home about.   When We left promptly at 5, the restaurant was still half empty. I had looked forward to trying this restaurant... but I probably won't go back due to the rude host turning away patrons from an empty restaurant.

PoS27fWWzVPDp8TRHsvsug.text: My husband and I loved everything about this place! Amazing service and melt in your mouth dishes. I highly recommend the beef short rib stew.

XzgKp0K7pley6A5ZQfA4Mg.text: Attended a birthday party here. The food was AMAZING especially the BEEF SHORT RIB stew, highly recommend. I also really liked the Salted Caramel pudding, it was to die for! Overall, the service was stellar and the ambiance was just right for the start of a wonderful night! Great job! I will be coming back...and so will the other 20 people in our large party! No one had any complaints.

QLRvIV6kPzcqRlDg-76zaw.text: Started off with the pretzels and cheese and fritters. Both were great! Then for the main course I had the turkey sloppy joe which consisted of ground turkey, pablano pepper and pepperjack cheese on a homemade bun... Amazing! And I topped that off with the blueberry cheesecake for dessert (YUM!!!). Overall great food and a very good experience.

E6OeQbJuqXS-B64g9WYkoA.text: I was relieved it wasn't chaotically busy as I anticipated for a Suns home game. Tried the pretzel & cheese appetizer and the hummus...both very savory! Ordered the filet mignon which was cooked perfectly. What sent me over the edge were the desserts! We shared 3 amongst the group: the peanut butter cup, the salted caramel pudding, and the molten chocolate cake. I couldn't decide which one i loved the most!

1ag2YTy3T2R99wxUW55sGw.text: Love it. Love the fondue. I haven't had anything here I don't like. The service is great too.

IhF3GLNu6ac9iyn_uD03eA.text: Rating this as an "American (new)"/bar-grill sort of place, then definitely 5 stars.  Food: well-prepared, and good diversity on the menu without being "and the kitchen sink." I liked that they had rotational items throughout the week, too (I think meatloaf was the night we went) along with chef specials. I went with the night's special of filet with crab, and it was very good.  They even have raw oysters, which were cleaned and prepared very nicely (it's funny, it always seems to me that the fancier seafood-focused places are where they leave them gritty, and places like this place just get them right).  Environment:  Cool vibe, energetic, and well-done lighting/decor.   Service: Special kudos on this front. The servers seemed to really know their stuff, had thoughtful explanations/recommendations, and were knowledgeable about the food they were serving. It appears that management here cares that their staff know what they're selling/serving, so this shows, and they seemed genuinely interested in our experience.  Tip: I'd recommend a reservation, even if you're just reading this and about to walk over from a local hotel. They were fairly busy, and we were a group of five. We had to wait about 15-20 minutes for a table (no problem), but they did ask if we had a reservation when we arrived. But I also don't think it's a problem if you don't have one, just FYI for those that are able.  Opportunity for improvement: I really wish they'd list the abv on their beer listings! With more craft brews and focus on IPA-styles, some can start to get high, so it'd be nice to see at a glance to help plan if 2 or 3 is going to be too many for some.   Thanks!

IchkfDDak66DYZkSadDqlw.text: Wow, I just walked in here sat down at the bar.... five minutes later I walked out.   The bar tending girl half heartedly says hi after I did, then walks away.... pretty tattoo boy standing in front of me wiping out a glass never makes eye contact or acknowledges me in any way. Across the bar from me, stands two female servers chatting up a storm, the dark haired one glances over then continues talking apparently blinded by her ridiculous fake eyelashes. The female bartender walks past again as if I wasn't there. There are a total of 2, that's ' two' others at the bar... the place is empty and apparently no one cares about serving a middle aged, balding patron without visible tat's. I could have look past it all if it hadn't happened the last time I was in about 6 mos. ago. It's a shame management doesn't notice. No one in the restaurant would have known any different if I hadn't said something to yet another server blonde and hostess on the way out. To their credit, they were both apologetic... "let me buy you lunch".... "thanks, but I just ate". Thank god there aren't mirrors in there.

aH8rxXtJRzIbx9c35zCS0g.text: Only got to stop in for a minute before we had to go to the Chris Titus show so we just got some quick drinks and an app. We ordered the shrimp which came out fried, nice and crispy with a zesty sauce, considering we were in a hurry we enjoyed it, wished we could have had time for their full menu but next time for sure. Also loved their whole prohibition erA themed uniforms, will return if ever in Phoenix again and also recommend

w0Aw5xxgAi-TWP58Z58tZA.text: Great lunch options...  Including, but not limited to, the oysters, raw shrimp, steak salad and cubano sandwich...  Well executed and fresh ingredients...

MUGWzB5kTU9yRVvCfgyZFQ.text: Not really a fan, the menu does not offer a lot of variety I went for dinner but I ended up just getting pretzel bites and cheese because none of the meals looked appetizing. Service was good A little pricey for the size of the portions you are served.

Pk8rKMiBWI5zwN-OwUNfZA.text: i liked it and got a kick out of the name so wanted to try it. Pretty awesome:)))))))))))

sdaxf8ONIlqAyVDYM6L7rQ.text: Second visit, I will call it an accidental visit as I had no idea that's where we were meeting...Not impressed at all. Mediocre food and not very flavorful.... just not my kind of menu. Got very sick after I got home. And so did my family member. Won't be back

OGKHWs6kGT4bt0ZvYizSxQ.text: There are restaurants with good food and then there are restaurants with food which makes your day better and your soul happier..The Arrogant Butcher definitely falls in the second category and no, they haven't paid me to write these  superlatives. Their food gives them the right to be arrogant, and yet, the entire staff is so friendly, nice, and accommodating. I had my first and last meal during my Phoenix trip at this place, and they were both beyond great. I went for dinner on a crowded Thursday night and avoided the wait by agreeing to sit on the high chairs near the chef's corner. I had the best scallop dish in my life that night, scallops and snap peas in a brown butter vinaigrette with bacon wrapped sweet potatoes. Yes, you read that right..bacon wrapped sweet potatoes, what a genius combination, my taste buds definitely thanked me profusely. I also had a bowl of seafood chowder which was very different (in a nice way) and tastier than chowders in general.  It was nice to chat with the chefs and watch them in action as I enjoyed my food. They gave me a few samplers too and even brought me a dessert on the house...wish I could give them an extra star for this! The chocolate cake with chantilly cream is such a delight to your senses, it will make you forget all your sorrows for a while, I promise.  Lunch was equally delightful. I had the best jambalaya in the whole wide world and tempted the guy sitting next to me at the bar to give up on his cheeseburger lunch plans and opt for the jambalaya. It was a very generous portion with bold flavors and such a wonderful spice kick. I also tried the salted caramel pudding with cream, and wasn't disappointed a bit.  Five dishes and all five-star dishes without burning too deep a hole in your pocket, so worth it. Please do visit this place and make your reservations ahead of time if you are in the Phoenix downtown area.
